metadata.subject: AT&T confirms it paid Trump lawyer Michael Cohen for 'insights' on administration

relationships.description: Cohen is described as Trump's longtime personal lawyer and confidante
AT&T paid Cohen's company for insights into the Trump administration
Novartis made payments to Cohen's company Essential Consultants

analysis.purpose: To share news article about payments made to Michael Cohen's company by various corporations
analysis.significance: Reveals corporate payments to Trump's personal lawyer for access/insights into the administration

notable_quotes: AT&T said that it had paid President Donald Trump's lawyer Michael Cohen for 'insights' about the Trump administration
Daniels says the money was in exchange for her signing a deal that required her to remain silent about an affair she claims to have had with Trump
red_flags: Shell company used for multiple transactions
Hush money payments related to presidential election

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion in this communication - it's sharing news about third-party activities

illegal_activity.description: This email shares a news article about Michael Cohen's activities - no first-hand illegal activity by sender or recipients

details: Media coverage of Michael Cohen payments

public_knowledge.context: This relates to the Michael Cohen scandal that was widely covered in media regarding payments for access to Trump administration and hush money payments

analysis.summary: Richard Kahn forwards a CNBC news article to Jeffrey Epstein detailing how AT&T, Novartis, and other companies paid Michael Cohen's shell company for insights into the Trump administration, while also covering the hush money payment to Stormy Daniels.
